Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Foxglove
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible camera for the money.  Execlent photos in the day, and execlent photos with the flash.  Zoom is incredible.  Indoor photos are good to very good, The low light photos have some strange and interesting artifacts when taking photos in automatic mode, however you can fix much of that with the manual settings if you know what you are doing. However that being said even the low light photos are better then most inexpensive cameras i have used.Battery life is good, not great but good.  I like that it takes standard AA batteries, so you never have to deal with dead propitary rechargables, In a pinch you can just buy some bat's and you are good to go. Works great with litium AA rechargables too, get them at any target or here on amazon. So you can get teh best of both worlds.The panorama feature is very slick, takes stunning shots.The only real minus I see is that the auto-focus will sometimes, well, just not focus very well. That may be adjustable with settings, this thing has a billion settings and I have only had it about a month and am still figuring it all out.I would recomend this camera hightly or it's youger brother the 12mp version. Same camera just slightly lower resolution. I have the 12mp at work and its a great camera too and significantly cheaper !  So if this is just a little pricy for you, get the 12mp one, its an awsome camera too.

Reviews.Title: Camera exceeded expectations
Reviews.Author: Gregory M. Barry "avid reader and news addict"
Reviews.Content: WOW, I waited for this camera to become available and then when it did and went onsale, I swooped in and ordered one that day. It arrived basically the next day.I bought this for the Zoom and view finder, the view finder is essential in sunny days. This replaced a Nikon L110 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 15x OpticalMy Previous Cameras were a Konica Minolta 4 MB (Still takes great pics after all the abuse, I use it as a backup, my 5 year old uses it) and the Nikon L110 (Nikon zoom broke on me within a year and needed to be replaced)The photos that this takes exceeded my Nikon L110 by alot. the zoom is great and the stabilization is fantastic. I am able to take the zoom shots and still crop a portion of the pic without losing any detailsI have not fully used all the features, the Panaramic is really nice and the pics are high MP... the pictures tend to be about 3 MBI have taken this to the Philly Zoo to fully test the shooting, Under all instances, bright, indoor, shady  - camera preformed better than my previous cameraI also take soccer pics and it has preformed great... I have challenenged myself to take one great pic a day... So far I have taken a picture of the Lightning (with the multishot feature) the moon just before dark, clouds, rainbows... and namy others... I am excited about taking photos with this camera because it gets the detailsI have recommended this to several people who have also bought it. You can't beat the features for the price.... A Pure winner

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA/FANTASTIC PRICE!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Bob F.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera before anyone reviewed it. Before it arrived, two reviews came in and they were not good. While waiting for camera to arrive,I started searching for another camera and was going to return the S2800HD. Camera arrived 2 days before we left on a Central America cruise. I decided to put in batteries and snap few pictures just to see how bad the camera was before sending it back. BOY I AM GLAD I DID THIS!!!!! WHAT A DEAL!!! I am a point and shoot photographer and this camera takes excellent pictures with just the snap of the shutter. Needless to say, I took this camera on cruise along with my old camera just in case for backup. Never pulled old camera out and got fantistic pictures day, night, sunrises and full moon shots over the ocean with the Fuji S2800HD. This is one of the best buys I have made in a long time.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot photo person
Reviews.Author: Kristen Smith
Reviews.Content: I just have to say that we are very pleased with this camera!!! We have lost/broken 4 camera's over the last 5 years. We didn't want to spend a lot of money on a new one with our previous experiences. We knew might sacrifice some quality for going for less expensive camera. Not the case. We are loving the great pictures and easiness of it's use.I definitely would recommend this camera. Also, for everyone who is bashing the camera because they can't take award winning photos, you sound like you need to pay around $1,000 for your next camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Faith Johnson "lilmama"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best purchases I have made in a long time. I LOVE this camera. Takes perfect pictures in all conditions. I have not used all the features on this camera just yet but I know over time I will. It has a great point and click system, So I never miss a shot! Great for scenery, active events such as sports, and great macro feature for those close ups! Worth every penny and what a great deal. The only disappointment was it came with 4 AA alkaline batteries.

Reviews.Title: disappointed to say the least.
Reviews.Author: nw adventurer
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th Fuji Finepix S series camera I've purchased.  My S1000 only needed to be replaced due to a chipped lense.  I spent a month looking at different cameras, DSLRs, and decided to wait out this new camera due to the success that i've had with the others.  I'm a point and shoot amateur photographer, and this camera line has made me look like quite the pro.  My camera goes everywhere with me, hiking, and packpacking, road trips... everywhere.  Producing fantastic photos most of the time.These are the issues i had with the S2800HD;1)  battery life is pathetic.  With the S1000, i can get a couple if not few, hundred photos out of four basic dur/ever. batteries. After 90 photos in one short outting, the batteries died on me.  (backpacking, every ounce counts, so i can't be packing in three times the amount of batteries.)2) the 'scene recognition' was often 'off'.  Taking photos of mountains, the camera would go into 'macro' mode.3) Holding the camera horizontally and vertically, while focused on the exact same point, would produce DRASTICALLY different images.  Horizontal would leave the photo washed out. Vert, provided rich wonderful color of the same object.4) On three different occasions, photos came out with very pink hues where such color was not present.  Specifically, in the clouds/sky over a waterfall on a rainy day, and worse, the 'stuff' in a stack of Oreos and the glass of milk as well.  QUite sure milk is white, not pink.5) I rec'd the camera two days before a very exciting, and incredibly scenic hike... The camera came with a basic instruction manual, and all of the added features had to be viewed on a disk.  I prefer to have a manual in the field.  Am i expected to carry my laptop with me to reference the best options for the shot, while hanging over a cliff?  Fuji let me down this time.After the excitement of purchasing this camera, I think i'm just going to go back to another S1000.  My entire family, and many of my friends have the S line of cameras all because they loved my very first.  I'm so disappointed that this new model didn't, from the very beginning, live up to basic point and shoot standards.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Tabby771
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera and unless you're a professional you dont need anything better. It does a ton of cool things and the pics are great. My only issue with this is that I wish it came with a charger & could be charged up. I definately recommend getting some rechargeable batteries for this or plan to carry 24 pack of AA's for a day out shooting.

Reviews.Title: POOR build quality!!
Reviews.Author: Marty Gillis
Reviews.Content: Sometimes you just don't get what you paid for. The Finepix 2800 HD is such a thing.I purchased this camera to replace an aging HP and being my 4th digital camera I felt I could easily find my way around and get down to the business of taking some decent pictures and videos. It pretty much does what it claims to do and I was initially happy with my purchase with a few reservations.As for as function goes, this is a pretty nice camera. A bit glitchy but the feature set is plentiful and I wanted something that had an actual viewfinder. While the image you see in the viewfinder is digitally rendered in low res from the larger LCD source it is preferable to using the large and better looking LCD screen on the back due to poor vision on my part.I like the way the camera feels in my hand and overall it seemed pretty solid except for the fact the lens cap does not snap on but rather just pushes on and can fall off easily.I have had no trouble taking pictures, adjusting parameters or uploading to my computer for printing and more permanent storage.  The auto focus fails intermittently and you can never be sure if your image will be in focus OR properly exposed.  I found much of the automatic features to be unnecessary bells and whistles as many of them do not work properly or dependably. Of course the full manual is only available to view on a device that will display it in PDF format. You get a small quick start guide that barely covers the basics. Par for the course these days.So why have I given it a low rating?  The answer is simple... VERY POOR BUILD QUALITY!  This thing is NOT made to be used with the included micro USB cable. The jack in the camera itself is just plain flimsy and not up to the job. I knew the minute I saw it that this would prove to be a problem.  And since it is the only way to get things out of the camera short of taking out the memory card each and every time, I feel this is inexcusable and a MAJOR design flaw.I am EXTREMELY careful with all my electronics and the jack withstood no more than 30 uses before virtually disintegrating inside the camera.  Using this miniscule connector type was their first mistake. I know it is industry standard for a lot of brands but is sucks, plain and simple! Can you imagine a light switch in your home only standing up to 30 uses before it fell apart, or a drawer on your Blu Ray player falling off after loading 30 different discs?Also, the battery door which also is used to access the memory card slot is flimsly , fussy and just plain poorly implemented. It is the next thing ready to go out on this camera.  I can still use it by removing the memory card and plugging it into a card reader to access my pictures, but that takes more time and is much more physically invasive to the already flimsy design of the camera. Just another thing ready to break.Basically, when you purchase something THIS expensive you tend to expect you can accomplish the most basic functions without fear of 'wearing it out' before 6 months have passed.  I have no reason to suspect or believe that a replacement camera would have any better build quality on those two crucial areas and now wish I would have purchased a Panasonic Lumix or some such model. They cost much less but are known for a robust build quality with great results.In future I will avoid Fuji film products and spend a bit more time researching my camera purchases. As nice as this camera initially appeared to be, and as good as some of my results have been, I still consider this thing a real piece of junk and I am totally unhappy with it.  (and of course it quit on me during the Thanksgiving Holiday which added extra insult to injury)  If you want something DEPENDABLE, I would firmly suggest you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas and am in love with it! The flash s nice and it takes  amazing picturesGood points of this camera* Nice, good flash* Fabulous pictures-that are clear* Fantastic zoom* Has (cool/many) settings* Has a view finder that is helpful\* Nice and easy to hold on to* Doesn't fly through batteries* Takes Fabulous videoThis camera is great for capturing family memories. Once its focused your pictures will be perfect! The price of it is so cheap for the quality! The zoom is great so you can get each detail the flash is nice and it takes FABULOUS video as well. Reviews.Title: Point..shoot.. It scores!
Reviews.Author: r@dikus
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about two weeks now, and I use it every chance I get.  I received it as a gift, and I am happy with it.  I do have some minor gripes, but I ill leave that for the Cons...  so without further delayPros:The camera has a setting for all needs.  take the time to pick the correct one... then you are golden.I like the fact that it uses plain old AA's for power.  I love the fact that I don't need a special cable of charging packIt seems to be sturdy enough for even me to use.  I hit everything...lolPicture quality is very good.. even when you zoom.The flash is good, and first camera I have owned that take great nigh ttime photosThe HD video, is great in a pinch.  Now I do it all with one device.I am also pleased with the fact that can switch from LCD to view finder.. more useful then I thought it would be!Cons:This is not a point and click camera!  Yes it has that option, but you will not always get the desired effect... you need to play with buttons and RTDM!The microphone picks up everything.  I mean everything.. ZOOM.. the video picks it up.. Breathe too deep.. the camera picks it up.  Flaw from design.Using the dial to select the settings can get confusing at times.. if you are in a hurry.. you may miss something.Focus Focus Focus... sometimes when you think your pictures is in focus, and you review them later.... not so happy. (Could be my eyes though)Sometimes... even with hight speed card.. it takes longer then expected to save info to disk.Zoom.. Not as good as I had hoped.  I have some cams that zoom better, but this more of a high end point and shoot (meaning you cant exchange the lenses)  so please take care and get closer if you can.Overall:I have had about five other camera, and this one has only been beat by one ( No I wont say what is it because this review is about this camera, but if you mail and ask I will tell you... if its that important to you)  I plan to use it often, and I have not reached the limit of what I can do with this one.  I think my next level would be expensive so let me use this for all it's worth.  The price they want for it... yes it is worth it.  Just be sure to read all the reviews.  Most of what you see it true.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as hoped.
Reviews.Author: R. Ault
Reviews.Content: I already had a Fujifilm Finepix S1500, but the longer zoom range and higher resolution of the S2800HD seemed to make it a better choice for some specific tasks we had in mind; chief among them was taking pictures of small items for posting on the website.  Sadly, that's the one place where this camera requires the most fiddling to get good results.  When used in the Macro and Super-Macro (close-up and extreme close-up) modes, the autofocus is often useless in the SR-AUTO mode; it will indicate that the shot is ready to take when the focus is not sharp at all, and it often takes several half-presses of the shutter button to get it to produce a non-fuzzy image in the viewfinder. If put into the other "auto" mode (denoted by a cryptic small red camera icon on the mode selector knob) the macro focusing becomes far more reliable, but still less than perfect. If you leave it in SR-AUTO mode by mistake, it's possible to cope to an extent by backing off away from the subject a bit so that the autofocus has a better chance to resolve the image.  The autofocus  does much better with light-colored, high-contract subjects than with dark things that have little detail, more so than a lot of other autofocus cameras I've used.  And the time required for the autofocus to home in on the right point (which it often misses, in fact) is still too long to expect quick responsiveness when shooting a moving subject.  The bottom line is that this isn't exactly point-and-shoot in that area, and since it has no manual focus capability at all, this is a real disadvantage.  Coupled with the fact that the super-macro (extreme close-up) is very limited, I have to downrate this model pretty strongly in its focusing.  Particularly annoying is the fact that its closest physical approach in super-macro is allowed only in ultra-wide zoom, which isn't very useful at all.Another place that it doesn't shine is in taking long telephoto images without bright light.  The amount of visual "noise" in the image is considerable when the shot is taken in this manner.  If you set it to use the flash to increase the fill-in light in the shadows, that can sometimes be reduced or eliminated, assuming that the subject is close enough for the flash to matter - but possibly at the expense of having the lighting as you would have wanted it.In general outdoor daylight shooting, though, its ability to correctly identify scene characteristics is usually pretty darned good - though overall, I find it produces better results in general if the SR-AUTO mode is simply avoided.  For indoor usage when taking shots of people, it's pretty good at automatically suppressing the redeye problem.While it may not have been the absolute best choice for what I needed, it does enough things well that I won't say it's best avoided, but there are clearly a lot of better choices available.  Most people would probably find it entirely acceptable for casual snapshot work, particularly for things like vacation scenery.Followup:  The camera had to go back for repair under warranty twice, the second time because the zoom didn't work after the first repair.  Overall, my opinion of Fuji has not been left in the same condition as it was before I bought this unit.  I'll be reading the reviews on their products very carefully before I buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Not as great as the older model
Reviews.Author: K. Beckum "Kenny DFW"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking that it would be better than my older model. I was shocked! A horrible winding noise recorded with my video. Using the zoom function and you get a winding moter noise thats recorded in the video. I was ashamed to show anyone the videos. E-mailed FujiFilm and the rep told me that it was the nature of the camera "sorry".  The older model does not have that noise and now I miss it! I'm so disappointed and I hate my camera. I'm looking at another brand all together. The pictures were ok, you cant force the flash when you need it and the focus is very slow. Its a terrible piece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, even better price!
Reviews.Author: Outlaw Starwind "Will"
Reviews.Content: After researching several camera manufacturers and camera models, I decided to purchase this camera. It takes amazing photos in all modes and is very easy to use. I have read many reviews on several sites and the feedback hasn't been very positive, but I can tell you, I am thoroughly enjoying this camera and look forward to advancing my photographic knowledge with it.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Kurt B "Kurt"
Reviews.Content: I am a knowledgeable photographer and own A nikon D300S and a Nikon D90 with a variety of lenses..I wanted something light to beat around the bush with and take pictures, when carrying the Nikons would not be practicable...I owned a Fuji camera before and it took fair pictures for what it was and that was only a 5 megapixel camera...This new one with 14 megapixels is real real dissapointing when it comes to picture quality...The pictures in all ranges of zoom are washed out and of very poor quality.  I did not expect to be able to take pictures like I do with my Nikons..But I did expect the quality to be better then my last Fuji..This is not the case...I will never buy another Fuji camera and would not recommend it to anuyone.in fact I am returning this camera today, it is just not even worth it as a knockaround camera.

Reviews.Title: 1st look into the Fujifilm S2800HD
Reviews.Author: Oldas
Reviews.Content: I compare this camera with previous (model Fujifilm S2550HD) - are almoust same, except resolution (14Mpix).What missing in S2800HD? Is not possible to set different aspect ratio than 4:3. Why? The model S2550HD have 4:3, 3:2, 16:9.If I forget this = good rate price/performance.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S2800HD - Barely ok
Reviews.Author: esterojas.graficas
Reviews.Content: I really expected more from this camera, after reading some comments and the presentation in Fuji's site. But all I got is a pretty looking small digital camera, with just decent resolution and an 18x Zoom with zero focus, which makes this feature useless. Flash works, but unless you have excellent light conditions, don't expect anything better than any other simple digital camera out there. Grain is still an issue when taking pictures inside.But maybe the biggest complaint I might have is that it does not work with Mac. The only way to transfer your pictures and videos to a Mac is using the included software, which is very dull and copies all files automatically every time you connect it to the computer, even the ones you have already downloaded.So overall, it is not a bad product for amateur photographers, but in my case, I was hoping to improve the quality of my photos, and I did... but not as much as I expected.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Luinia Nouel
Reviews.Content: This camera I like almost everything. It has good lens and is easy to use. The only thing I do not like is that when you record videos, the sound sometimes distorts. But I love the quality of photos and every day you learn something from it. I recommend it to fans of digital photography.

Reviews.Title: It's a decent quality camera
Reviews.Author: Vallaya S.
Reviews.Content: i find i get SOME of the best photos using the "sport" mode. but all in all this camera is good for some novice point and shoot photographers considering all of the setting which you really need to know what you're doing to use them. Otherwise like i said just use "sport" mode. And i also found i got SOME better quality photos with my Ipod touch 4g. Also, when it was dark in a room and i had the flash on and the photo was just dark or in some cases it was too bright.

Reviews.Title: Great camera

Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife a B-day gift and she loved it shoot 14 MP and 18X the zoom you can really see the camera quality.

Reviews.Author: Michael L. Kearney
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera. I'm far from being an expert, but, taking night photographs can be troublesome w/o using a tripod. To me, lens focuses on the nearest object....Other than that, it works well and durable.

Reviews.Title: A huge disappointment
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in this camera. I got the Finepix S5100 in 2005 and loved the camera. I used it all of the time and in every situation imaginable. indoors, outdoors, parties, beach and boat, mountains, macro settings etc. I spoke so often about it and how well it took pictures you would think I worked for Fuji or owned stock in the company.Then on a visit to Costco one day with one of my employees in the fall of 2011 I came across the S2800HD. I was very excited to see it and for the price as well. Without my knowledge my employee took up a collection from my staff and presented it to me for Christmas 2011. I was thrilled and started taking pictures right away. The quality wasn't good but I told myself its more advanced and I needed to study the owners manual and get educated on it. Well that didn't help either. The only decent thing about the camera that I have found is the panorama picture. All other aspects suck!!!!!Picture quality is poor, zooming in and taking pictures is a joke. Whether inside or outside the noise on the pictures ruins most shots. I hate to say it but this camera would be overpriced at $50.00. With technology advancing these days at such a high rate I never would've expected a new Fuji Finepix product to perform as crappy as it has. I have dusted off my old camera today and will begin using it again. I will donate this one tomy children.

Reviews.Title: Camera isn't bad but customer service leaves much to be desired.
Reviews.Author: Flcracker
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice little point and shoot.  It replaced my Canon PowerShot A 590 which I liked much more but died after a short period of usage.  The Fujifilm has a much better on off switch and doesn't look like it will self destruct as readily as the Canon did by inadvertently being turned on.  I wanted and needed a viewfinder, disposable batteries, and SD memory card.  Those three things together aren't easy to find in a good, reasonably priced point and shoot.  Both cameras had all three of these features.I had some questions about the camera when I first received it, but the distributed in NJ wasn't any help at all.

Reviews.Title: So so camera
Reviews.Author: Happy2bMe
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. Thought I was getting a super deal, but ended up being a super disappointment. Camera started to malfunction with in weeks. Little stuff at first that I just thought might be user error, it being a more advance camera, come to find out nope its the camera. As always I could have gotten the bad Apple. I will stick with Cannon from now on.

Reviews.Title: Poor Reliability & Consistency
Reviews.Author: Sam "General Sam"
Reviews.Content: I'm a real estate appraiser, and my primary camera requirement is reliability and consistency. That is, I need to know that 99% of the time the pictures I take will be clear and in focus. I am an auto mode, P&S; type of photographer, and I have no desire to learn all the various manual functions or the artistic features. I just want a good picture, and, at times, the telephoto function is must.However, with this camera, in-focus shots happen about 80% of the time, and that is a deal breaker. I always ensure I have a yellow [+] in my viewer, which indicates a focused picture, hold the camera very still, and wait a second or two after the shutter clicks. Still, about 1 in 5 pictures will be out of focus, which is not always discernable on the viewer. Also, at times, the telephoto shots are grainy. My workaround is to take two or three shots of every scene, and on a typical appraisal I'll take 70 or 80 photos.I've had the camera for over a year now. I've read the owner's manual, and I am sure I'm doing everything correctly. My wife, who is also an appraiser, has had the same experience with her camera, which is the same model.We've decided that we must go back to the Olympus, probably one of the 800 zoom series. For the obvious reasons, I generally eschew cameras with proprietary batteries, rather than the ubiquitous AAs; however, the inconvenience of a backup battery is preferable to ensure that I have reliable and consistent photos.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: Geo.
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with my Fujifilm FinePix S2800 14.. For the money, I don't think you could select a better camera.. It also works great with a tripod.. I took it to the beach in Oct of this year.. Some great pictures.. Very satisfied.. George

Reviews.Content: I have bought a lot of cameras and this one is the best, upon getting it and setting it up I was amazed at the ease of how compatible it was to the user, I am planning on using this camera to make a scrap book of events that are going to be happining this summer in Philadelphia, I know I made the right choice in selecting this camera, I will get back to you on my results.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera

Reviews.Content: wrote it as the purchase I am happy enough to help me the best photos and videos in hd and a pretty cheap price a large zoom and smile detection features with other major and recommend it very fast delivery time

Reviews.Title: Lo Mejor
Reviews.Author: Julimar

Reviews.Title: My Little Point n Shoot
Reviews.Author: Cgholston
Reviews.Content: Its a good camera for those who want a simple point n shoot! It's pretty straight forward with its settings and how to use it. Its best use is outside!!I don't like that the camera runs off of 4 AA batteries and you need certain ones to charge with the camera! I just expected that camera would have a internal battery and it would charge when ever I link it to my labtop!overall I love my little camera and I'm no photographer so I need to play with it some more!!Hope you enjoy yours!

Reviews.Title: FinePix S2800HD
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: The S2800HD does a fair job of photography.  I was somewhat disappointed to see my wife's CoolPix do a lot better job. I use the S2800HD has a quick point and shoot with some quick up scale attributes. However, to be 14 MP it left a lot to be desired. The photos were over exposed in almost every scene, not by much, maybe 1f stop. Even in select scene shot mode exposure was off. Mean time my wife is clicking away with no idea of what she's doing and her photos were great. I had to constantly adjust exposure using manual mode. The other problem, no hot shoe. Yes you can use the pop up flash and adjust for exposure but sometimes I like the beef of  an add on flash. Next time I'll pull out the big gun 35 mm and snap away.  Or, just purchase a top of the line digital and be done with it.

Reviews.Title: NOT a good idea
Reviews.Author: Carl J Reed
Reviews.Content: Having had a Fujifilm S5000 camera and finding no fault with it at all, we decided to buy the Fujifilm S2800HD. NOT a good idea! The set of batteries that came with the camera did not last long. Since I was setting up the camera with time and date and just folling around with it, that waas no surprise. But the second set of batteries only lasted for 16, yes I said 16 pictures! I did not take any movies with it. Just snap shots. The Third set of batteries lasted 17 pictures. Both sets of batteries were new, fresh out of the box.The controls are different from the S5000 so there is a "what I am used to" factor involved, but it is not a handy camera to use. The on / off switch is not easy to use. And you have to be a magician to open the battery compartmentNeedless to say, the camera is being returned and I think I'll start looking for a different brand. I hope this helps. Good Luck. ANd buy LOTS of batteries!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: sam1j
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to see a camera with specs like this for such a great price. This is where the excitement ended. The camera was such poor quality all round. The zoom function makes it impossible to see anything on the LCD screen and the actual photo where worse than my 5mp point and shoot. I am hoping that this was just a "dud" and of course I sent it straight back after seeing the results in the first few minutes of opening. It also uses std AA batteries which was surprising. All in all the quality of this camera was poor all round. There was extreme lag time from shooting to the camera ready to take another shot - I did not even get to try the video.

Reviews.Title: Finepix S2800
Reviews.Author: featha
Reviews.Content: Camera is overall a good product, but there are only two F-stops available F3.1 and F5.6 - frustrating. The camera has a lag of 2seconds before it focuses and then you can take the picture. The rest of the camera is great to use.

Reviews.Title: Use to be I loved Fuji's cameras
Reviews.Author: Alex Vox
Reviews.Content: There's something wrong with Fuji. Use to be I loved their cameras for nice image quality, balanced approach to features, original sensors, versatility and price. Out of this enumeration, none appealing to me anymore. Today FUji lost its own sensor development, uses some tiny sensors in SLR sized bodies, image quality absolutely horrible (deplorable) and their abandoned DSLR market. I would say they probably wil be kicked off digital camera market in near future, which is sad, as they have been accounted for some really great cameras in a past.I tried number of fuji cams and all of them, have bad fuzzy jpegs even in bright sunlight, primitive image control, very poor dynamic range. Unless they are going serious about what their are doing, they will be kicked off the market very soon. Today, when Canon, Sony, Nikon offer such great quality point and shoot cameras for just about hundred dollars... I wouldn't buy this.

Reviews.Title: Owner's Manual
Reviews.Author: Salvador Santana
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and have to learn how to use it. Disappointed you have to go online to get the owner's manual. Very disappointed about this. Fuji is saving money in printing costs, but customers don't like to go online to get the manual. How about buyers of this camera who have not a computer? How about it? SALVADOR SANTANA, SalvadorRiv@aol.com

Reviews.Content: Frankly, I expected better of it as well as much, do not use it much, has let me down more than once!! And also the battery is very bad not last long, unfortunately I will not repeat this experience again ...

Reviews.Author: mickey mouse
Reviews.Content: shoots great vivid photo's has great features ,, camera has a panarama mode that  shoots 3 picturestogether ,, you shoot the first then camera gives you yellow cross just line it up with the yellow circle and it shoots itself for 2nd 3rd shot ,, very easy to do,, but what you dont know is what you really shot when getting pic printed ,, standard panarama is 4x11 or 4x12  but with this camera it actually shoots bigger when printing pic at ritz they told me my panaram shot can be printed4x11 or 4x12 but they found if you want it printed uncrop and print the whole pic they foundthat its actual print size is 5 x 23 at 10.00  to print or go bigger 12 x 36 for 20.00camera shoots great color pic up close and at great distancehas a large lcd on backbattery does have a lithium feature in setup featuresin sp special features mode shoots alot of options to make pic takeing a snaphighly recommend this camera also its twin 2950 ,, yes 2950 a little nicer but onlyhas one other feature added in sp is its babby mode other than that there identical

Reviews.Title: Good Starting Camera
Reviews.Author: juststartingout
Reviews.Content: I have not had a chance to really get to know my camera yet. I haven't had a chance to take it outside. I have only used it indoors so far. I have been happy with the pictures I have taken. I have notice that you have to hold down the button half way to focus on a subject before taken the picture to get a good clear shot. The one thing that I don't like about the camera is that it hesitates when I push the button. I have missed some really good action shots. I don't know if this has to do with the focus or not.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Baseman
Reviews.Content: Yes this camera has a big zoom, 18x.  Yes it is 14 Mega Pixels.  Yes it looks like a dSLR.  But that's where you should stop looking at this camera like judging a book by its cover!It has very poor low light capabilities.  Have you ever heard of 'blue rain'?  The cameras lack of low light sensitivity has it compensating to make the picture brighter, but that results in a lot of blue on the screen.  If you don't use the flash, the picture that you take has a lot of blue in it as well.If you use the zoom while taking a video, the motor noise for the zoom is very VERY loud in the video!!!  Louder than what you hear when using it.One day I pointed the camera at my daughter sitting at the kitchen table with a bright day outside through the window behind her.  The result was streaks of light from the window into the dark areas below and no, this was not lens flare as there was no direct light shining inside the house.If you want a camera that you know you won't be taking any of the pictures in the settings I have described above, then by all means, knock yourself out.  But I very promptly returned the camera!  I don't recommend this camera to anybody, not even a new shutter bug.  You'll be fighting and cursing these problems and kicking yourself for not listening to what I have said.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: sent back YESTERDAY!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Clary
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking product, BUT using it is another thing! I sent it back yesterday. I could not get a clear picture on auto or with changed /adjusted settings.

Reviews.Title: fuji camera
Reviews.Author: J. Solomon "jammis"
Reviews.Content: Was uncertain of the quality of the camera at purchase. i have been using it quite abit and have been very pleased it its operation. getting great shots. have lots of picture options. to date i have been very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Poster quality camera
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: This review is from: Fujifilm FinePix S2800HD 14 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Electronics)This is not a DSLR. I bought a 16GB SDHC and $15 monopod with it and it does an awesome job with the kids sporting event photos at hi-res.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera yesterday.  I'm returning it today.Reasons:1.  The only written instructions are in a 27 page "basic manual."  The real manual, 100+ pages is on a CD.  Time consuming and awkward to use.  Does Fuji think I'm going to carry around a computer when I'm away from home?  This is just an example of how these companies are penny pinching.  Another example of this cheapness is that the hole for a tripod has plastic threads.2. The only way to get my pictures into my iMac, is to install Fuji's viewer software.  My iMac won't read the SD card.  My Dell laptop could read the card, though. I want to be able to just load the files into my iMac directly without having to deal with cables and software, which is what I have to do with this camera.  (My iMac has no trouble reading other SD cards.3.  The clock lost 5 minutes overnight.4.  The viewer doesn't have focus adjustment, so everything is blurry.

Reviews.Title: really nice camera
Reviews.Author: Pablo de Buenos Aires
Reviews.Content: i'm so happy with this camera, it has a great relationship between price and quality...it costs a half as similar on other brands. My previous experience with fujifilm was great (very good lens). I haven't use it so much but for the moment i'm very happy. I recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera!Good price!..:)
Reviews.Author: smn
Reviews.Content: well i am quite satisfied with this camera,takes pretty good shots...surely an awesome price for a Full HD camera!!...:D

Reviews.Title: EVF Stinks
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of Fujifilm cameras for a few years now.I wanted a compact cam with an electronic view finder since I NEVER use the LCD screen.I take photos the old fashioned way, with the camera braced up to my eye so that I can see through the lens and support the camera at the same time for nice steady shots.This also allows me to shoot with out my reading glasses.Well this EVF does NOT have a diopter adjustment resulting in blurry image through the EVF.I returned it the next day.If you don't use the EVF then this one might be for you, but I didn't even get familiar with it since I knew it would be going back ASAP.

Reviews.Title: Poorly Made
Reviews.Author: Alex T.
Reviews.Content: This has to be the second worst item I have bought from Amazon. poor quality poor workmanship  I was totally disappointed  fuji needs to quit makin cameras.  I can go on to complain about this item but I will not.  this product is not worth the money they're asking 4  trust me just go get a canon or nikon.
